item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, September 13, 2024 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: FlowTracker – Track data flowing through Java programs (29 points | discuss)
2. JG Ballard's Apocalyptic Art (10 points | discuss)
3. Swimmable Cities (195 points | 159 comments)
4. Better-performing “25519” elliptic-curve cryptography (116 points | 29 comments)
5. FDA Authorizes First Over-the-Counter Hearing Aid Software (201 points | 76 comments)
6. How to Spot NASA's Solar Sail Demonstration Streaking Through the Night Sky (41 points | 2 comments)
7. Boeing workers vote to strike (256 points | 155 comments)
8. Notes on OpenAI's new o1 chain-of-thought models (464 points | 369 comments)
9. Breaking Down OnlyFans' Economics (204 points | 255 comments)
10. Entire staff of game publisher Annapurna Interactive has reportedly resigned (178 points | 61 comments)
11. Understanding Concurrency, Parallelism and JavaScript (69 points | 11 comments)
12. Data sleuths who spotted research misconduct cleared of defamation (458 points | 79 comments)
13. Show HN: A whiteboard that writes math equations (34 points | 22 comments)
14. Two Useful Prompts to Explore Intent and Behaviour (17 points | 4 comments)
15. Exploring the scalable matrix extension of the Apple M4 processor (82 points | 4 comments)
16. DiyPresso: DIY Espresso Machine (111 points | 136 comments)
17. The Magnetic Field of the Milky Way (2000) (58 points | 16 comments)
18. Notepat – Aesthetic Computer (105 points | 26 comments)
19. F3 – Fight Flash Fraud (101 points | 36 comments)
20. The Spellbinding Life of Koji Kashin: Japan's Legendary Wandering Magician (7 points | 1 comment)
21. Show HN: iFixit created a new USB-C, repairable soldering system (814 points | 366 comments)
22. Does your startup need complex cloud infrastructure? (177 points | 180 comments)
23. Why Haskell? (368 points | 488 comments)
24. Kolmogorov-Arnold networks may make neural networks more understandable (246 points | 72 comments)
25. GAZEploit: Remote keystroke inference attack by gaze estimation in VR/MR devices (164 points | 91 comments)
26. The Strange Case of the Rogue HP-12c Calculator (86 points | 19 comments)
27. Who Owns Nebula? (158 points | 41 comments)
28. Imbue (Formerly Generally Intelligent) (YC S17) Is Hiring Software Engineers ( | hide)
29. Edge Image Builder (18 points | 1 comment)
30. If I could dissect a sauropod (128 points | 16 comments)
